facts.text: Appellants presented applications against each set of the respondents under s.175, U.P. Tenancy Act, 1939 for ejectment stating that they were the sir-bholders of the land occupied by the respondents as non-occupancy tenants and that the period of five years during which the respondents were entitled to retain possession under s.20 of the Act had expired.

Respondents contested the notice of ejectment alleging that the land in suit was not sir, that the appellants were not sir-holders, that appellants paid local rate exceeding Rs. 25/- in the United Provinces, Agra and Oudh, and held more than 50 acres of sir land. They claimed to be hereditary tenants of the land in dispute, in accordance with ss. 14, 15 and 16 of the Act.
Papers were forwarded by the Tehsildar to the Assistant Collector in charge of the sub-division, in accordance with s. 179 of the Act. Applications deemed plaints, proceedings continued as suits.

Sub-Divisional Officer decreed the suits on February 28, 1946, holding that the land in suit was sir, appellants were sir-holders, each did not pay local rate exceeding Rs. 25/- either in 1938 or 1940, did not hold more than fifty acres of sir land or sir and khudkasht land not sublet in 1317 F. (July 1, 1939 to June 30, 1940).

Respondents appealed to Additional Commissioner, Benaras, repeating contentions and adding non-compliance with s.19 as amended by U.P. Tenancy Amendment Act, 1947 (effective June 14, 1947). Additional Commissioner confirmed findings and held substantial compliance with amended s.19, dismissed appeals.

Board of Revenue set aside decree, remanded for fresh disposal due to non-compliance with amended s.19 and rules, and directed decision on contention of adivasi rights under U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 (U.P. 1 of 1951). Order dated August 6, 1954.
U.P. Tenancy Act, 1939 came into force on January 1, 1940.

Appellants filed documents: khewats of 1345, 1346, 1347 Fasli (July 1, 1937 to June 30, 1940), khatauni jamabandis of 1345 and 1347 Fasli, statements showing shares, areas (sir 152.33 acres total, khudkasht 19.93 acres), local rate Rs. 75.5.11 total, no individual exceeding 50 acres or Rs.25 local rate, pedigree.
Land in suit was sir from time of first settlement in Nineties of last century, not under cls. d or e of s.4 Agra Tenancy Act, 1926.

legal_issues.text: Whether the land in suit was sir on January 1, 1940, appellants were sir-holders not assessed to local rate > Rs.25/- on Jan 1, 1940 or June 30, 1938, and held <50 acres sir/khudkasht.
Whether amended s.19 U.P. Tenancy Act applies to pending appeals, and whether appellants substantially complied with its requirements and rules 239A, 239B.
Whether respondents acquired adivasi rights under U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950.

petitioner_arguments.text: Amended s.19 does not apply as enacted after first date for evidence; impossible to furnish particulars then. Alternatively, substantially complied by filing documents giving necessary particulars under rr.239A, 239B.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.19 U.P. Tenancy Act as amended; rr.239A, 239B

respondent_arguments.text: Land not sir, appellants not sir-holders, paid local rate >Rs.25/-, held >50 acres sir; hereditary tenants u/ss.14,15,16. No compliance with amended s.19(1) and rules.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: ss.6,14,15,16,19 U.P. Tenancy Act; s.31 Amendment Act 1947

court_reasoning.text: To prove sir status under s.6: land sir on Jan 1,1940; sir-holder not assessed >Rs.25 local rate U.P.; predecessor not so assessed June 30,1938. Appellants proved these; trial court found land sir, holdings <50 acres.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Appellants established facts; land did not cease to be sir.

court_reasoning.text: Amended s.19 procedural, no substantive change; requires particulars before first evidence date to ascertain s.6 proviso and area. s.31 Amendment Act requires pending appeals decided per amended Act.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Applies to pending appeals; substantial compliance suffices.

court_reasoning.text: Documents filed (khewats, khataunis 1345-47 Fasli, statements) cover required periods, show local rates, areas <50 acres each, <Rs.25; only minor gap on cls.d/e s.4 Agra Act sir, but land old sir, not that type. Substantial compliance.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Board erred not considering documents; sufficient compliance.

holdings.text: Substantial compliance with amended s.19 and rules 239A,B achieved; Board erred in remanding on that ground.
Remand to Board to decide adivasi rights contention, calling findings if needed.

statutes_cited.relevance: Basis for ejectment suits, definition of sir, compliance requirements, hereditary tenancy claims.

statutes_cited.relevance: Amended procedure for sir ejectment suits; retrospective application to pending proceedings.

outcome.summary: Appeals allowed; orders of Board of Revenue set aside; cases remanded to Board for decision per law, including respondents' adivasi rights contention under U.P. Zamindari Abolition Act, calling trial court findings if needed.
outcome.relief_granted: Set aside remand order; remand for merits decision.

key_quotes.text: "Section 19 therefore, did not bring about any real change in the substantive law affecting the question whether certain land is sir or not, according to the definition of sir in s. 6 of the Act."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "We are of opinion that in this the Board of Revenue was wrong... there had been substantial compliance with the provisions of amended s. 19 and the rules framed thereunder."
key_quotes.speaker: court
